content.headline: Your Complete Pregnancy Nutrition Handbook
content.intro: Proper nutrition during pregnancy supports both your health and your baby's development. This comprehensive guide covers daily requirements, food safety, managing pregnancy symptoms through diet, and ensuring you get all essential nutrients for a healthy pregnancy.

sections.title: Daily Nutritional Requirements
sections.content: Aim for these daily targets during pregnancy:
points: Protein: 75-100 grams for tissue building and growth
Iron: 27 mg to support increased blood volume
Folate: 600 mcg to prevent birth defects
Vitamin D: 600 IU for calcium absorption and immune function

sections.title: Managing Pregnancy Symptoms Through Diet
sections.content: Use nutrition to alleviate common pregnancy discomforts:
points: Morning sickness: Eat small, frequent meals and dry crackers
Heartburn: Avoid spicy foods, eat smaller portions
Constipation: Increase fiber and water intake
Fatigue: Choose complex carbs for sustained energy
Food aversions: Find alternative nutrient sources

sections.title: Food Safety During Pregnancy
points: Avoid raw or undercooked meat, eggs, and seafood
Skip unpasteurized dairy products and juices
Limit high-mercury fish like shark and swordfish
Wash all fruits and vegetables thoroughly
Practice good kitchen hygiene and food storage
